devdoc.author: Stefan George - <stefan@gnosis.io>Richard Meissner - <richard@gnosis.io>

multiSend(bytes).details: Sends multiple transactions and reverts all if one fails.

params.transactions: Encoded transactions. Each transaction is encoded as a packed bytes of                     operation has to be uint8(0) in this version (=> 1 byte),                     to as a address (=> 20 bytes),                     value as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data length as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data as bytes.                     see abi.encodePacked for more information on packed encoding

devdoc.title: Multi Send Call Only - Allows to batch multiple transactions into one, but only calls

multiSend(bytes).notice: The code is for most part the same as the normal MultiSend (to keep compatibility),         but reverts if a transaction tries to use a delegatecall.This method is payable as delegatecalls keep the msg.value from the previous call         If the calling method (e.g. execTransaction) received ETH this would revert otherwise

userdoc.notice: The guard logic is not required here as this contract doesn't support nested delegate calls
